title: Using custom header in REST client together with `@NotBody` annotated argument results in warning from EndpointIndexer
body:
### Describe the bug

Defining a REST client with a method using a computed header value provided by a method parameter annotated with the `@io.quarkus.rest.client.reactive.NotBody` annotation results in a `Using a body parameter with jakarta.ws.rs.GET is strongly discouraged.` warning from the [EndpointIndexer](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/independent-projects/resteasy-reactive/common/processor/src/main/java/org/jboss/resteasy/reactive/common/processor/EndpointIndexer.java) when starting the application in development mode.

Example client:

```java
@RegisterRestClient(configKey = "example")
public interface MyTestClient {

    @GET
    @ClientHeaderParam(name = "Authorization", value = "Bearer {token}")
    String getSomethingById(@QueryParam("id") String id, @NotBody String token);
}
```
Resulting warning:

```sh
2024-02-15 14:29:06,779 WARN  [org.jbo.res.rea.com.pro.EndpointIndexer] (build-73) Using a body parameter with jakarta.ws.rs.GET is strongly discouraged. Offending method is 'com.example.MyTestClient#java.lang.String getSomethingById(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String token)'
```

We started to observe this issue when switching from the `3.6` to the `3.7` release line.

### Expected behavior

No warning is emitted.

### Actual behavior

The warning `Using a body parameter with jakarta.ws.rs.GET is strongly discouraged.` is emitted.

### How to Reproduce?

1. Define example client as above.
1. Run `./gradlew quarkusDev`

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "21.0.1" 2023-10-17

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.7.3

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Gradle 8.6

### Additional information

_No response_
